xmlns="urn:isbn:1-931666-22-9" xmlns:ns2="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:schemaLocation="urn:isbn:1-931666-22-9 http://www.loc.gov/ead/ead.xsd">poly_rg_011Guide to the Vintage Equipment Collection RG.011Collection processed by Lindsay AnderbergPoly Archives at the Bern Dibner Library of Science and Technology, NYU LibrariesPoly Archives at the Bern Dibner Library of Science and Technology, NYU LibrariesNYU Libraries5 MetroTech CenterBrooklyn, NY 11201646-997-3530polyarchives@nyu.eduThis finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace 2022-10-11T19:38:31EnglishDescribing Archives: A Content StandardNovember 2021
Finding aid revised and edited by Zoe Blecher-Cohen, Mandy Abokhair, and Aileen Thong in 2021 to update the institutional change from NYU-Poly to NYU and for compliance with DACS Required Elements for Archival Description. Materials entirely in English.
Poly Archives at the Bern Dibner Library of Science and Technology, NYU Libraries
Vintage Equipment Collection RG.011 11
12 Cubic Feet 13 items
Early-mid 20th century The items in this collection relate to the fields of electrical and civil engineering, as well as supplemental equipment, and were used by engineers in the early to mid 20th century. Bern Dibner Library of Science and Technology 5 MetroTech Center Brooklyn, New York, 11201 (646) 997-3943 polyarchives@nyu.edu
Biographical / Historical
The items in this collection were transferred to the Poly Archives by various university departments. The most prominently represented departments include Civil Engineering and Electrical Engineering.
Scope and Contents
Equipment in this collection includes items civil and electrical engineers would have used in the early to mid 20th century. Surveying equipment, such as a theodolite and transit, as well as electrical engineering instruments, such as a decade capacitor, decade resistor, potentiometer, and volt meter are included. The equipment ranges in date from the early to mid 20th century.
Arrangement
Items in this collection are arranged alphabetically.
Conditions Governing Access
This collection is currently on display in the Bern Dibner Reading Room of the Bern Dibner Library of Science & Technology.
Please contact the archives to view items in this collection.
Conditions Governing Use
Permission to publish materials must be obtained from:
Poly Archives & Special Collections Bern Dibner Library of Science and Technology 5 MetroTech Center Brooklyn, NY 11201
Phone: (718) 260-3943 Fax: (718) 260-3756 E-mail: archives@library.poly.edu
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date; Vintage Equipment Collection; RG 011; box number; folder number or item identifier; Poly Archives at Bern Dibner Library of Science and Technology, New York University.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Materials found in collection; there is no documentation concerning the provenance of these materials.
Civil engineering Surveying Electrical engineering Engineering Kodak camera Equipment and supplies Radio -- Equipment and supplies Brownie camera
Series I: Vintage EquipmentBook Binding Stapler: Acme Stapling Co., Camden, NJ5963undated1
Biographical / Historical
This heavy-duty stapler was used to bind the pages of manuals and textbooks.Current Transformer: Astra Corporation, Quincy, MA5964undated2
Biographical / Historical
A transformer is a piece of equipment used by electrical engineers to test electrical current. If the current in the circuit is too high for a direct measurement, the current transformer is used to produce a reduced current proportional to the current in the circuit.Decade Capacitor, Series 1575: Cornell-Dubilier Electronics Inc., Plainfield, NJ5965circa 19403
Biographical / Historical
A decade capacitor is used for testing and calibration of electrical equipmentDecade Condenser Type 219-K: General Radio Co., Cambridge, MA5966circa 19504
Biographical / Historical
The condenser was used when a resistor of unknown or precise value is needed. Condensers are now referred to as capacitors.Decade Resistor Type 1432-K: General Radio Co., Cambridge, MA5967circa 19505
Biographical / Historical
The resistor box contains resistors of many values with mechanical switches to allow precision switching from one value to another. This configuration offers a convenient way of quickly changing resistance in a laboratory setting.Electrical Cables: Consolidated Edison Co., New York, NY5968undatedThese cables were removed from the display when it was discovered they were leaking a viscous fluid. They were bagged and returned to the archives.6
Biographical / Historical
NYU-Poly and Con Edison have a long-standing relationship of mutual research and support. Con Ed was one of NYU-Poly's first neighbors in the new MetroTech Center complex. These electrical cables and components were donated from Con Ed to NYU-Poly.
Note on cable reads, "Piece of cable installed in Morgan Stanley building, that failed."Gauge: Airco, New York, NY5969undated7
Biographical / Historical
This gauge was used to measure the pressure of various gases.Hawkeye Brownie Camera: Eastman Kodak, Rochester, NY 5970circa 19508
Biographical / Historical
The Hawkeye was one of the most popular Brownie cameras made. It was cheap, easy to use, and disassembled easily for cleaning: the perfect camera to take into the field.Potentiometer: Leeds and Northrup Co. , Philadelphia, PA5971circa 19509
Biographical / Historical
This instrument is a voltage divider used for measuring electric potential.Theodolite: Buff & Buff Mfg. Co., Boston, MA5972undated10
Biographical / Historical
The theodolite is an optical surveying instrument used by civil engineers to measure angles in vertical and horizontal planes. When the telescope is pointed at an object, the angle of orientation can be measured with precision.Transit: Buff & Buff Mfg. Co., Boston, MA5973undated11
Biographical / Historical
A transit is a type of theodolite. Rather than being closed, the transit has an open design where measurements are made by reading verniers on metal circles. This transit, produced by the Buff & Buff Company, is often referred to as a Buffmaster Transit.
On Loan
On loan to President Andrew Hamilton's Office, 4 February 2016Volt Meter, Model 377: Simpson Electrical Co., Chicago, IL5974circa 195012
Biographical / Historical
This instrument is used to measure the electrical potential difference between two points in an electric circuit.Wheatstone Bridge: Leeds and Northrup Co., Philadelphia, PA5975undated13
Biographical / Historical
The Wheatstone bridge is a type of potentiometer that measures electrical resistance by balancing two legs of a bridge circuit.Series II: 2021 Accretioncirca 1930-1965Bern Dibner Library of Science and Technology 5 MetroTech Center Brooklyn, New York, 11201 (646) 997-3943 polyarchives@nyu.edu
Immediate Source of Acquisition
These items were donated to the Poly Archives by Frank Baranowski's daughter, Susan Baranowski in February 2021. Accession 20-001.
Arrangement
This donation is housed in two boxes and arranged into two sub-series: Sub-series A: Engineering Equipment, circa 1930-1965 and Sub-series B: Academia, 1954. Items are listed alphabetically.
Biographical / Historical
Frank Baranowksi was born on November 1, 1921 in Bayonne, New Jersey and received a BS in Chemical Engineering from New York University Heights on June 5, 1943 and an MS from the University of Tennessee. Baranowski was a World War II vet and an engineer on the Manhattan Project. He passed away in Williamsburg, Virginia on August 30, 2017.
Scope and Contents
These items mainly include engineering equipment such as slide rules, drafting tools, and scales from the 1930s-1960s. They are located in bay 29 shelf 4C.Sub-series A: Engineering Equipmentcirca 1930-1965Clay Adams Co.
